Summary : This image provides a detailed description of the Verus Opinion stock rating system, including its methodology, coverage statistics, and a visual indicator of a "Hold" rating. illustration: # Visual Indicator : • A vertical stack of three colored rectangles: green (top), gold (middle), and red (bottom). • The gold rectangle is labeled "Hold" with a black arrow pointing to it, indicating the current rating. # System Description : • The Verus Opinion is an empirically-derived, historically back-tested stock rating system with buy, hold, and sell opinions. • The system analyzes company earnings quality, balance sheet, income statement, technical and valuation analysis, and insider transactions. # Coverage Statistics : • As of 2025-07-04, the Verus Opinion covers 4,359 companies. • 19.8% are rated Buy, 64.2% rated Hold, and 16.0% rated Sell. # Provider Information : • Verus Analytics Inc is a private, independent research firm specializing in institutional ratings systems. • The firm is unaffiliated with Refinitiv. # Logo : • The Verus Analytics logo appears in the lower right, with "verus" in large serif font and "analytics" in smaller sans-serif font. Analysis : • The visual indicator clearly highlights the "Hold" rating among the three possible outcomes. • The majority of companies (64.2%) are rated Hold, with fewer rated Buy or Sell, suggesting a conservative or neutral bias in the system's current ratings. Summary : This figure presents the consensus analyst recommendation for a company, as aggregated from 66 analysts, using a standardized 5-point scale ranging from "Strong Sell" to "Strong Buy." The overall mean recommendation is "Buy," and the distribution of individual analyst ratings is shown. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "I/B/E/S MEAN" • No explicit axis labels; horizontal bars represent the count of analysts for each recommendation category. • Categories (from top to bottom): Strong Buy, Buy, Hold, Sell, Strong Sell. • Numeric values shown at the end of each bar: Strong Buy (22), Buy (37), Hold (6), Sell (1), Strong Sell (0). Data Points : • Strong Buy: 22 analysts • Buy: 37 analysts • Hold: 6 analysts • Sell: 1 analyst • Strong Sell: 0 analysts Design Encodings : • Green bars for positive recommendations (Strong Buy, Buy). • Grey bar for neutral recommendation (Hold). • Red bars for negative recommendations (Sell, Strong Sell). • Numeric values in black at the end of each bar. • A horizontal recommendation scale is shown below the summary, with a black arrow pointing to the "Buy" region. Distribution & Trends : • The majority of analysts (59 out of 66) recommend either "Buy" or "Strong Buy." • Very few analysts recommend "Sell" (1) or "Hold" (6), and none recommend "Strong Sell." Analysis : • The analyst consensus is strongly positive, with the vast majority recommending "Buy" or "Strong Buy." • Negative sentiment is nearly absent, as indicated by only one "Sell" and zero "Strong Sell" recommendations. • The mean recommendation is firmly in the "Buy" category, as visually indicated by the black arrow on the scale. Summary : This figure presents two price and volume charts for a financial asset, showing its performance over 1-year and 5-year periods, including returns and trading volumes. line and bar charts: # 1-Year Price and Volume Chart : • Title: "1-Year Return: 21.6%". • Price chart (top): Y-axis range approximately 100 to 160 (units not specified, likely price). • X-axis: Months from July 2024 to June 2025, labeled as Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun. • Volume chart (bottom): Y-axis labeled from 0K to 500,000K (units not specified, likely shares or contracts traded). • Volume bars correspond to each month. # 5-Year Price and Volume Chart : • Title: "5-Year Return: 1466%". • Price chart (top): Y-axis range approximately 0 to 160 (units not specified, likely price). • X-axis: Years from 2020 to 2025, labeled as 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025. • Volume chart (bottom): Y-axis labeled from 0K to 1,000,000K (units not specified). • Volume bars correspond to each year. # Design Encodings : • Price is shown as a filled orange area chart in both panels. • Volume is shown as vertical gray bars below each price chart. • No gridlines or additional markers are present. • Returns are stated in bold above each chart. # Distribution & Trends : • 1-Year: Price fluctuates between ~100 and ~160, with a dip around early 2025 and a strong rise toward June 2025. • 5-Year: Price remains low and flat from 2020 to mid-2022, then rises sharply, with significant growth and volatility from 2023 onward. • Volume shows periodic spikes but no clear long-term trend. # Analysis : • The asset experienced modest growth (21.6%) over the past year, with a notable dip and subsequent recovery. • Over five years, the asset delivered a dramatic cumulative return of 1466%, with the majority of gains occurring after 2022. • Volume does not show a consistent upward or downward trend, but there are periods of increased trading activity, especially during price surges. • The data suggests a recent acceleration in both price and volatility, particularly in the last two years. BUSINESS SUMMARY NVIDIA Corporation is a full-stack computing infrastructure company. The Company is engaged in accelerated computing to help solve the challenging computational problems. The Company's segments include Compute & Networking and Graphics. The Compute & Networking segment includes its Data Center accelerated computing platforms and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions and software; networking; automotive platforms and autonomous and electric vehicle solutions; Jetson for robotics and other embedded platforms, and DGX Cloud computing services. The Graphics segment includes GeForce GPUs for gaming and PCs, the GeForce NOW game streaming service and related infrastructure, and solutions for gaming platforms; Quadro/NVIDIA RTX GPUs for enterprise workstation graphics; virtual GPU software for cloud-based visual and virtual computing; automotive platforms for infotainment systems, and Omniverse Enterprise software for building and operating industrial AI and digital twin applications. Summary : This figure presents the trailing price-to-earnings (PE) ratio for a security or index from 2020 to 2025, comparing the most recent value to historical averages and benchmarks. line chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "TRAILING PE" • X-axis: Years (2020 to 2025, labeled at yearly intervals) • Y-axis: Trailing PE ratio (0 to >50, labeled in increments of 5 up to 50, with a ">50" mark at the top) Data Points : • Single series: Trailing PE ratio over time • Notable values: – Trailing PE (most recent): 52.9 – 5-Year Average: 74.0 – S&P 500 Index Average: 29.6 – Industry Average: 57.1 • The line fluctuates, mostly near or above 40, with several dips below 40 and a notable drop below 30 around 2023–2024. Design Encodings : • Orange line for the PE ratio • No markers, gridlines present • No log scale, single axis Distribution & Trends : • The PE ratio remains above 35 for most of the period, with brief dips below 40 and a sharp drop below 30 in the 2023–2024 range. • The ratio recovers to above 45 by 2025. Analysis : • The trailing PE ratio is volatile but generally high compared to the S&P 500 Index Average (29.6). • The most recent value (52.9) is below the 5-year average (74.0) and slightly below the industry average (57.1). • The chart shows periods of sharp decline and recovery, with the lowest point occurring between 2023 and 2024. • The PE ratio does not fall below 20 at any point and spends most of the time above 40. Summary : This figure presents the Forward Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio over time, comparing the most recent value to historical averages, the S&P 500 Index average, and the industry average. line chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "FORWARD PE" • X-axis: Years (2020 to 2025, labeled at yearly intervals) • Y-axis: Forward PE ratio (range: 0 to >50, labeled at intervals of 5 or 10) • Dashed horizontal line labeled "5-Yr Average" Data Points : • Orange line: Forward PE ratio, plotted weekly from 2020 to 2025 • Key values (as text annotations): – Forward PE: 33.6 – 5-Year Average: 41.7 – S&P 500 Index Average: 23.7 – Industry Average: 31.0 Design Encodings : • Orange solid line for Forward PE ratio • Black dashed horizontal line for 5-Year Average • No markers; line only • No error bars or confidence intervals Distribution & Trends : • Forward PE ratio fluctuates between approximately 20 and above 45 from 2020 to 2025 • Several peaks above the 5-Year Average line, especially in 2020–2021 • Noticeable dips below the 5-Year Average in 2022 and 2023 • Recent trend (late 2024) shows Forward PE rising but still below the 5-Year Average Analysis : • The Forward PE ratio has generally trended below its 5-Year Average since 2022, with some recovery in late 2024. • The most recent Forward PE (33.6) is above the S&P 500 Index Average (23.7) and the Industry Average (31.0), but below the 5-Year Average (41.7). • The chart highlights periods of overvaluation (above average) and undervaluation (below average) relative to recent history. The report is updated daily, although the ratings are updated weekly. - **Peer Analysis** - • The Peer Analysis section of the report compares the company to up to ten of its closest peers. The peers are selected based on competitors data from the company's annual reports, the number of cross-over analysts with recommendations on both companies, and the same industry classifications. - • The Reference data Business Classification (TRBC) schema is used for industry comparisons. It is designed to group together correlated companies that offer products and services into similar end markets. **Highlights** The automated text-generation system from LSEG creates highlights summarizing the most noteworthy data. The bullets will vary by company and will change from week to week as different criteria are met. Earnings Earnings Per Share The quarterly and annual earnings per share are presented when available, along with the mean, high and low. Quarterly data is displayed for the past 4 quarters (actual) and the next 2 quarters (estimated). Annual data is displayed for the past 2 years (actual) and the next 2 years (estimated). Mean Estimate Trend The mean estimates show how the consensus has changed over the past 30 days and 90 days for the upcoming two quarters and two years. The percentage change is calculated for the company as a means for comparison by measuring the difference between the current consensus estimate and that of 90 days ago. Earnings Surprises The surprise summary includes the total number of quarters (and percentage) in the past 12 quarters in which earnings surprises were positive, negative, or in-line. In order to be recognized as a positive or negative surprise, the percent must be greater than 2% above or 2% below the consensus, respectively. - **Fundamental** - **Profitability** - • Revenue Growth: (Net Sales - Previous Net Sales) / Previous Net Sales - • Gross Margin: Gross Profit / Net Sales - • Return on Equity: Net Income / Total Equity - • Net Margin: Net Profit / Net Sales - **Debt** - • Current Ratio: Current Assets / Current Liabilities - • Debt-to-Capital: Total Debt / Total Capital - • Interest Funding: Interest Expense / Operating Cash Flow - • Interest Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / Interest Expense - **Dividend** - • Dividend Growth Rate: (Dividends per Share - Previous Dividends per Share) / Previous Dividends per Share - • Dividend Funding: Dividends / Operating Cash Flow - • Dividend Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / (Interest Expense + Dividends) - • Dividend Yield: Annual Dividends per Share / Current Market Price per Share Relative Valuation A discount occurs when the company's ratio is valued more favorably (lower) than that to which it is compared. Valuation Averages Negative values are excluded when calculating the averages. A maximum value of 100 is placed on Trailing P/E and Forward P/E, and a maximum value of 5 is placed on Forward PEG when calculating the averages. **Risk** **Magnitude of Returns** The best / worst daily returns in the past 90 days and the best / worst monthly returns in the past 60 months. **Volatility** The standard deviation of the stock price over the last 90 days and last 60 months, along with the average and largest intra-day stock swing. Beta Measures the tendency of a security's returns to respond to swings in the market, based on the beta of the company versus the relevant index. Correlation Determines how closely the returns of the stock and the relevant index move together, measured over the last 90 days and last 60 months. Price Momentum Relative Strength Measures the speed and change of price movements. A value above 70 may be overbought while a value below 30 may be oversold. Seasonality The average monthly return for the current month and next 2 months for the company and industry, over the past 10 years. A lower industry rank indicates a higher return. Insider Trading Monthly Buys and Sells The total market value of open-market buying and selling is displayed by month for easy comparison. Transactions by trusts and corporations are excluded, along with buys greater than $10 million and sales greater than $50 million. **Institutional Holders** The top five institutional holders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total share holdings. Summary : This image provides a detailed description of the Verus Opinion stock rating system, including its methodology, coverage statistics, and a visual indicator of a "Hold" rating.

illustration:
# Visual Indicator :
• A vertical stack of three colored rectangles: green (top), gold (middle), and red (bottom).
• The gold rectangle is labeled "Hold" with a black arrow pointing to it, indicating the current rating.

# System Description :
• The Verus Opinion is an empirically-derived, historically back-tested stock rating system with buy, hold, and sell opinions.
• The system analyzes company earnings quality, balance sheet, income statement, technical and valuation analysis, and insider transactions.

# Coverage Statistics :
• As of 2025-07-04, the Verus Opinion covers 4,359 companies.
• 19.8% are rated Buy, 64.2% rated Hold, and 16.0% rated Sell.

# Provider Information :
• Verus Analytics Inc is a private, independent research firm specializing in institutional ratings systems.
• The firm is unaffiliated with Refinitiv.

# Logo :
• The Verus Analytics logo appears in the lower right, with "verus" in large serif font and "analytics" in smaller sans-serif font.

Analysis :
• The visual indicator clearly highlights the "Hold" rating among the three possible outcomes.
• The majority of companies (64.2%) are rated Hold, with fewer rated Buy or Sell, suggesting a conservative or neutral bias in the system's current ratings.

Summary : This figure presents the consensus analyst recommendation for a company, as aggregated from 66 analysts, using a standardized 5-point scale ranging from "Strong Sell" to "Strong Buy." The overall mean recommendation is "Buy," and the distribution of individual analyst ratings is shown.

bar chart:

  • Categories (from top to bottom): Strong Buy, Buy, Hold, Sell, Strong Sell.

  • A horizontal recommendation scale is shown below the summary, with a black arrow pointing to the "Buy" region.

Distribution & Trends :
  • The majority of analysts (59 out of 66) recommend either "Buy" or "Strong Buy."
  • Very few analysts recommend "Sell" (1) or "Hold" (6), and none recommend "Strong Sell."

Analysis :
  • The analyst consensus is strongly positive, with the vast majority recommending "Buy" or "Strong Buy."
  • Negative sentiment is nearly absent, as indicated by only one "Sell" and zero "Strong Sell" recommendations.
  • The mean recommendation is firmly in the "Buy" category, as visually indicated by the black arrow on the scale.

Summary : This figure presents two price and volume charts for a financial asset, showing its performance over 1-year and 5-year periods, including returns and trading volumes.

line and bar charts:
# 1-Year Price and Volume Chart :
  • Title: "1-Year Return: 21.6%".
  • Price chart (top): Y-axis range approximately 100 to 160 (units not specified, likely price).
  • X-axis: Months from July 2024 to June 2025, labeled as Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun.
  • Volume chart (bottom): Y-axis labeled from 0K to 500,000K (units not specified, likely shares or contracts traded).
  • Volume bars correspond to each month.

# 5-Year Price and Volume Chart :
  • Title: "5-Year Return: 1466%".
  • Price chart (top): Y-axis range approximately 0 to 160 (units not specified, likely price).
  • X-axis: Years from 2020 to 2025, labeled as 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025.
  • Volume chart (bottom): Y-axis labeled from 0K to 1,000,000K (units not specified).
  • Volume bars correspond to each year.

# Design Encodings :
  • Price is shown as a filled orange area chart in both panels.
  • Volume is shown as vertical gray bars below each price chart.
  • No gridlines or additional markers are present.
  • Returns are stated in bold above each chart.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • 1-Year: Price fluctuates between ~100 and ~160, with a dip around early 2025 and a strong rise toward June 2025.
  • 5-Year: Price remains low and flat from 2020 to mid-2022, then rises sharply, with significant growth and volatility from 2023 onward.
  • Volume shows periodic spikes but no clear long-term trend.

# Analysis :
  • The asset experienced modest growth (21.6%) over the past year, with a notable dip and subsequent recovery.
  • Over five years, the asset delivered a dramatic cumulative return of 1466%, with the majority of gains occurring after 2022.
  • Volume does not show a consistent upward or downward trend, but there are periods of increased trading activity, especially during price surges.
  • The data suggests a recent acceleration in both price and volatility, particularly in the last two years.

BUSINESS SUMMARY
NVIDIA Corporation is a full-stack computing infrastructure company. The Company is engaged in accelerated computing to help solve the challenging computational problems. The Company's segments include Compute & Networking and Graphics. The Compute & Networking segment includes its Data Center accelerated computing platforms and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions and software; networking; automotive platforms and autonomous and electric vehicle solutions; Jetson for robotics and other embedded platforms, and DGX Cloud computing services. The Graphics segment includes GeForce GPUs for gaming and PCs, the GeForce NOW game streaming service and related infrastructure, and solutions for gaming platforms; Quadro/NVIDIA RTX GPUs for enterprise workstation graphics; virtual GPU software for cloud-based visual and virtual computing; automotive platforms for infotainment systems, and Omniverse Enterprise software for building and operating industrial AI and digital twin applications.

REPORT TIPS
The Company in Context Report provides a comprehensive company analysis based on market data from LSEG and a proprietary rating from Verus Analytics. The report is updated daily, although the ratings are updated weekly.

- **Peer Analysis**
- • The Peer Analysis section of the report compares the company to up to ten of its closest peers. The peers are selected based on competitors data from the company's annual reports, the number of cross-over analysts with recommendations on both companies, and the same industry classifications.
- • The Reference data Business Classification (TRBC) schema is used for industry comparisons. It is designed to group together correlated companies that offer products and services into similar end markets.

**Highlights**  
The automated text-generation system from LSEG creates highlights summarizing the most noteworthy data. The bullets will vary by company and will change from week to week as different criteria are met.

Earnings  
Earnings Per Share  
The quarterly and annual earnings per share are presented when available, along with the mean, high and low. Quarterly data is displayed for the past 4 quarters (actual) and the next 2 quarters (estimated). Annual data is displayed for the past 2 years (actual) and the next 2 years (estimated).

Mean Estimate Trend  
The mean estimates show how the consensus has changed over the past 30 days and 90 days for the upcoming two quarters and two years. The percentage change is calculated for the company as a means for comparison by measuring the difference between the current consensus estimate and that of 90 days ago.

Earnings Surprises  
The surprise summary includes the total number of quarters (and percentage) in the past 12 quarters in which earnings surprises were positive, negative, or in-line. In order to be recognized as a positive or negative surprise, the percent must be greater than 2% above or 2% below the consensus, respectively.

- **Fundamental**
- **Profitability**
  - • Revenue Growth: (Net Sales - Previous Net Sales) / Previous Net Sales
  - • Gross Margin: Gross Profit / Net Sales
  - • Return on Equity: Net Income / Total Equity
  - • Net Margin: Net Profit / Net Sales

- **Debt**
- • Current Ratio: Current Assets / Current Liabilities
- • Debt-to-Capital: Total Debt / Total Capital
- • Interest Funding: Interest Expense / Operating Cash Flow
- • Interest Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / Interest Expense

- **Dividend**
- • Dividend Growth Rate: (Dividends per Share - Previous Dividends per Share) / Previous Dividends per Share
- • Dividend Funding: Dividends / Operating Cash Flow
- • Dividend Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / (Interest Expense + Dividends)
- • Dividend Yield: Annual Dividends per Share / Current Market Price per Share

Relative Valuation  
A discount occurs when the company's ratio is valued more favorably (lower) than that to which it is compared.

Valuation Averages
Negative values are excluded when calculating the averages. A maximum value of 100 is placed on Trailing P/E and Forward P/E, and a maximum value of 5 is placed on Forward PEG when calculating the averages.

**Risk**  
**Magnitude of Returns**  
The best / worst daily returns in the past 90 days and the best / worst monthly returns in the past 60 months.

**Volatility**  
The standard deviation of the stock price over the last 90 days and last 60 months, along with the average and largest intra-day stock swing.

Beta  
Measures the tendency of a security's returns to respond to swings in the market, based on the beta of the company versus the relevant index.

Correlation  
Determines how closely the returns of the stock and the relevant index move together, measured over the last 90 days and last 60 months.

Price Momentum  
Relative Strength  
Measures the speed and change of price movements. A value above 70 may be overbought while a value below 30 may be oversold.

Seasonality
The average monthly return for the current month and next 2 months for the company and industry, over the past 10 years. A lower industry rank indicates a higher return.

Insider Trading  
Monthly Buys and Sells  
The total market value of open-market buying and selling is displayed by month for easy comparison. Transactions by trusts and corporations are excluded, along with buys greater than $10 million and sales greater than $50 million.

**Institutional Holders**  
The top five institutional holders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total share holdings. Possible values for the institution type include Brokerage, Funds, Inv Mgmt, or Strategic.

Executive Holders  
The top five executive insiders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total direct common share holdings (options are not considered). Indirect holdings are excluded, as the owner may not actually have investment discretion over these shares. Insiders who have not filed any transactions or holdings over the past two years are excluded, as the individual may no longer be associated with the company. Direct shares held must be greater than 1,000 to be considered.
